text: is a former Japanese football player. He played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Mori was born in Nagasaki Prefecture on July 12, 1961. After graduating from Fukuoka University, he joined Japan Soccer League Division 1 club Fujita Industries in 1984. The club was relegated to Division 2 in 1990. In 1992, the club won the champions in Division 2. He retired in 1992. He played 131 games and scored 19 goals in the league. On June 2, 1988, Mori debuted for the Japan national team against China. In 1989, he played at 1990 World Cup qualification. He played 8 games for Japan until 1989. ==Statistics== Japan National Football Team Database |- |1988||1||0 |- |1989||7||0 |- !Total||8||0 |} ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1961 births Category:Living people Category:Footballers from Nagasaki Prefecture Category:Japan international footballers Category:Japan Soccer League players Category:Shonan Bellmare players
title: Masaaki Mori
